comments.author: m-wada@usa.com
comments.text:
A simplest approach is;
   Define Search Folder(Virtual Folder) with "search target = all folders/subfolders of all  accounts" and "If Status isn't Read".
If user doesn't have too many folders, such as 1,000,000 folders, and if user doesn't do rename/move/delete/create of maany mail folder so frequently, predefined Search Folder is practically usable. 

However, Virtul Folder keeps search target folders open, so many xxx.msf files are kept as opeed at once, This easily produce "file handle shortage" if very many/deep folders are held by user. 
So, approch like next may be needed.
   1. Define a Virtul Folder for "Unread mails", 2. Scan all folders for "folder with Unread mails". if number of folders exceeds Max, return,
   3. Change search target folder of the Virtual folder, 4. set comdition = Status isn't Unread, 5 open the Virtual folder at Tab
New API, new Virtual Folder relevant object/idl, may be needed for ese of implementation or addon implementtion.
   2 is done by simple script, because scan of all folders is pretty simple/easy by AccountManager service.
   Difficulty is in "dynamically do 3", although generating virtulFolders.dat text itself is pretty simple/easy.
If prototype script for above approach will be implemented based on such new API/Object/idl, adding toolbar button for "Unread mails", "Alll mails from/to someone in all mail folder" like one is easily done by utilizing "Custom Buttons" addon.
See bug 532159 for example of "Adding archive like Gmail Labeling Button" by "simple script code(almost dead copy of Tb's Archive code)" + "paste the script to a button by Custom Buttons". This kind of button can be called "enhanced filter by small addon or by user's custoization".

Another approach : Enhancement in Gloda.
   Gloda has information about all mails Tb holds. Search of unread mail == simply do SQL statement of "Select xxx where Status EQ "Unread".
